alert.note: Alert for City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Fairfax; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:21AM EST until December 18 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following counties, City of Manassas, City of Manassas Park, Fairfax, Loudoun and Prince William. * WHEN...Until 745 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 221 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Rainfall is coming to an end, but many roads and streams remain flooded. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Centreville... Reston... South Riding... Herndon... Broadlands... Lansdowne... Lowes Island... Brambleton... Dulles International Airport... Ashburn... Linton Hall... Sterling... Chantilly... Wolf Trap... Great Falls... Bull Run... Countryside... Haymarket... Arcola... Manassas... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Fairfax; Prince William
